name: Chimichurri Roasted Potatoes
author: JennCrippen
summary: These potatoes are a great side dish all year round. They stand up to grilled and roasted meats very well. Sometimes I add a chopped cherry pepper to the chimichurri to add a little heat and color.
ingredients: 2 pounds red potatoes, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 420 degrees F (215 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Place cubed potatoes in a large bowl and cover with cold water
Drain water from potatoes and pat potatoes dry with paper towels or a clean kitchen towel
Return potatoes to the bowl and add 2 tablespoons olive oil and generous pinches of salt and pepper
Transfer potatoes to the prepared baking sheet and spread them out evenly
Bake in the preheated oven until browned on the bottom and edges, about 35 minutes
Meanwhile, prepare the chimichurri by combining parsley, basil, garlic, 2 tablespoons olive oil, vinegar, and a pinch of salt in a bowl
Stir together and let sit while potatoes finish baking
Remove potatoes from the oven and transfer to a large serving bowl
Add chimichurri to hot potatoes and mix until covered
